intro: Didymosalpinx abbeokutae, commonly known as the Kukutu bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of western Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue. The plant has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found growing near streams or in dense undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
